lines.text: How much do I get for the information I gave you on Waxman?
No arrest, no money.
It's my fault he's dead? It took me six months to get next to him. I got expenses, you know.
Guess what? Uncle Sam don't give a shit about your expenses. You want bread, fuck a baker.
You have my word you won't have to do the whole nickel.
What does that mean?
Grimes is the best lawyer in the state. It'll either be an appeal bond or a sentence reduction.
And the check is in the mail, and I love you, and I promise not to come in your mouth...
Yo! Yo! Yo! Yo!
Hello Jeff.
What are you doing in my crib.
You sent two assholes to do Cody and they blew it. I paid you half, I want it back.
Yeah, well uh... I'm trying to get that money back myself. I had to front the whole purchase to get my people to do their thing. So I ain't got any more.
Well, then uh... you better try and shit 40 grand, because I ain't leaving without it.
I owe you Cody. Next time there be no fuck-up.
What next time? He's in protective custody.
Hell, protective custody don't mean shit to me! The man's dead.
In a pig's ass!
Why are you chasing me?
Why you running?
'Cause you're chasing me, man!
I wanna get Rick Masters.
I've taken four falls, I've never ratted anybody in my life, and I've had plenty of chances, believe me.
Masters is your friend. I don't blame you, I would never hang up a friend. Anybody who would is a piece of shit. Thing is, your friend tried to have you iced.
That doesn't mean I'm gonna roll over and play informer. If you're looking for a pigeon, go to the park.
First you rip me off, then you set up Carl, now you want to fuck my lady?
Oh, man. She came on to me, man. I swear it.
Oh, what a tragedy. I want my 600K.
I didn't have anything to do with getting Cody set up...
Do you know that your house is under surveillance? Do you know you're living like a fuckin' animal in the zoo?
I'm gonna bag Masters, and I don't give a shit how I do it.
I've got a friend in Palm Springs, Lenne Green. He owns the Oasis. Do you know him?
I got a friend in Hollywood, Donald Duck. You know him?

[talking about Max Waxman]
He's a lying son of a bitch! He's probably the motherfucker who did me. He ratted me to the feds. I'll kill him when I get out! I'm gonna give that fuckin' scumbag a serious headache. May God strike me dead if I don't waste him.
We got an FBI agent killed. You hear that?
What do you want me to do about it, John?
It's just a matter of time before they fuckin' identify us. They got a good look at us.
A face is bullshit without a name.
They got a make on the car!
Look, they would have sent it out over the teletype if they had anything. They're grabbing at shit.

Everybody knows Rick Masters won't go near a job without front money. You should also know that I never fucked a customer out of his front money. I've been coming to this gym three or four times a week for five years. I'm an easy man to find. My reputation speaks for itself. The fact is that if you can't come up with the front money you're not for real.

[noticing a 'Do Not Enter - Wrong Way' street sign]
We're going this way!
I am straight with Masters. I would never fuck with Masters.
[Jim has been shot]
Shitbag.
Buddy, you're in the wrong place at the wrong time.
I'm ready to die!
Nobody's gonna die. Look, you and I are gonna go downstairs and talk.
Death to Israel and America, and all the enemies of Islam!
[Vukovich has been given details about the prospect of testifying in court]
But you can't get involved, right?
Not directly.
What would it cost for your indirect involvement.
[pause]
I know it's a tough call, but it's one you're going to have to make rather quickly.
I can't hand out my partner. I can't do it, even if I have to go to the joint.
If I was one of your asshole cronies, you'd be spread-eagled on your desk to do this for me!
Don't say something you'll regret later.
[Richard Chance gets the judge's authorization to hold Carl Cody]
If this prisoner escapes from custody, I'll make you testify in open court about how he made a fool out of you.
What would happen if I stopped giving you information on Masters?
Why?
I'm just curious.
[pause]
I'd have your parole revoked.
You know what this is?
What's the game?
It's no game. Just walk.
Why?
Why? Because if you don't, I'll blow your fucking heart out.
Next time, there'll be no fuck-up.
What next time?
Die, motherfucker!
I am a martyr!
A 19th Century Cameroon, yes? Your taste is in your ass!
[shoots Waxman in the face]

Quentin Dailey got 30 points they said. The guy's unbelievable, man. Say all you want about Michael Jordan, he's a great fuckin' ball player. But Quentin Dailey's got a gun like a howitzer, man. Thirty feet. Boom, boom, boom. He gets hot, he's fabulous.
[last lines]

[to Ruth]
You're working for me now.
You broke your contract with me Jeff. Now, I don't know whether you're into it but you're gonna have to suck on this until you give me back my paper!
I was reading about the stars. Talked about how the stars are the eyes of god. I think it's true, don't you?
No, I don't.
Hey, what shit they're showing tonight?
It's that galactical warrior movie.
I hate that space shit, man!
Nothing but science fiction, man.
Remember me? Football game at the airport?
So now you want to commit a robbery?
I wouldn't call it that.
What would you call it?
Taking down a douche bag who's trying to break the law.
I'm getting too old for this shit.
How you making it?
Like every other swinging dick in this place makes it. Day by motherfucking day.
[Masters enters his fancy car]
You still driving that piece of shit?

[to Chance and Vukovich]
You're not the first agents to get next to Masters.

[to Vukovich]
Because I represent Masters, I can't get deeply involved in your case, if you see what I mean.
I don't have a lot of time. I'm in the middle of a trial.
What kind of trial?
It's a dope case. Client got busted smuggling fifty pounds of cocaine. I should be able to get him off, though. Seach warrant's weak.
Weak?
Color of the house is listed as brown in the warrant, when in fact it's beige and yellow.
You should be ashamed of yourself.
I don't make any apologies for being an attorney. If I didn't accept the case, somebody else would, without a doubt. Without a doubt.
I love the rain.
Yeah, it's groovy.
Can I talk to you for a minute?
You must be a mind-reader. I was just going to call you. I have decided to let Vukovich work with you.
Do I have a choice?
Oh, is there someone else you'd prefer? You're welcome to fill out a Form 19, and list all the reasons you'd rather not work with him. Your info would be strictly confidential.
[Richard Chance is looking at the journal he took from Max Waxman's residence]
It's a crime scene, buddy. The book is evidence. What if the cop remembers it's missing?
Shit. The rookie couldn't remember what he saw. He wasn't in there long enough.
Where's the key?
I don't have it.
He doesn't have it. What a guy!
I want my paper, Jeff. I can't afford to have it circulating right now.
I told you I don't have it.
Get it.
Now look, my man. I told you I don't have what you're lokking for, So why don't you make it easy on yourself...
[draws a knife on Masters]
and just shag your ass out of my crib! Now you be a printer! Go get some ink, ant start printin' some more of that shit!
you better get your ass into protection, baby! Because you ain't shit on the streets! You understand that? You ain't got the nuts! Kiss my ass! Pussy motherfucker!
Who are they?
Who are you?
This is Mr. Jessup, whose name isn't really Jessup, wo says he's from Palm Springs but doesn't have a tan. You're not wired, are you?
We're *on* with Masters tonight!
They want me to have an operation, but I can't stand the thought of one of those prison butchers slicing me open. I'd rather drink this shit pink cement.

[to Chance, who's posing as "Mr. Jessup"]
Like your work!
[laughs]
